TopicTitle: How to send maned mission to Duna

Articles.Content:
I already built several interplanetary probes, i send manned mission to Duna in 0.17 but it was long time ago and one way trip:)

I wondering does is possible to assembly spacecraft in Kerbin orbit and send it to Duna, does anybody tried this?

Try this:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/27741-Duna-Tripper-6-form-Zokesia-Skunkworks%21?p=339450#post339450

Easy to fly, but it is massive.

Of course, many people have done it. From specialized ships sent one by one to mothership carrying the entire mission equipment in one go.

I'm planning to send a few of these ship on Duna. But I keep pushing it back.

(excluding the Quad-Nuclear-Tug, it was just here to refuel the ship)

From left to right you have 4 ship : A nuclear-tug ; a probe-fuel-tank ; a nuclear-engine-tank ; Then a lander capable of landing then launching from Duna (in theory)

Edited June 1, 2013 by Kegereneku
Check this post. Includes a very simple .craft file and basic instructions for getting to Duna and back.

It is indeed possible to assemble a ship in orbit and send it to Duna. This is a simple example:

I used this ship to make my Duna tour. I had enough dV to visit Duna, then visit Ike, then transfer back to Duna, and then transfer home.

Good luck!

Quite a bit of fuel can be saved by instead of first establishing orbit around Duna, making a direct descent entering the atmosphere at interplanetary speed and rely mainly on parachutes to slow the craft down. That's what real life Mars rovers do.

Put Pe at about 8~9km and aim to have final descent take place over/in a large crater to get as much lower atmosphere between the point where the parachutes deploy and the landing location. Landing on Duna's highlands like this is very likely to fail.

There are three ways you can do it....

1)

Go screaming into the atmosphere just enough to make a suborbital loop, then position oneself for a pinpoint landing....

2)

Use a refueling Depot to refuel your ships.

3)

Not exactly a proper way to Duna but you can take an SSTo to Duna Orbit. Landing would be much harder, but orbital space planes could be a good way to resupply fuel depots or Space Stations.
